svg.text: The sensors turn red when they detect a sound. Upon detecting a sound, they transmit the time at which they detect the sound and their current location.

This example shows a SoundSource (concentric circles icon) moving through a field of sensors (SoundSensor actors, with transluscent circle icons) that detect the sound and communicate with a SoundTracker actor (overlapping ellipses icon). The SoundTracker performs sensor fusion to triangulate the location of the sound source. It generates a plot with estimated locations.
The SoundSource and SoundTracker actors are composites, while the SoundSensor nodes are defined in Java. In all cases, you can look inside to view the implementation.
Authors: Philip Baldwin, Xiaojun Liu, and Edward A. Lee
Every two seconds, send a sound.
Every second, move the sound source.

entity.name: Ramp
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value

svg.text: Location coordinate system has Y increasing downwards, but plotter has Y increasing upwards.
